thread.title: 16 Underrated US National Parks to Add to Your Bucket List
thread.title_full: 16 Underrated US National Parks to Add to Your Bucket List

author: Jess Bolluyt
title: 16 Underrated US National Parks to Add to Your Bucket List
text:
View all U.S. national parks are the perfect place to enjoy the great outdoors, especially if you don’t go to the same national park everybody else chooses for a summer vacation | iStock.com 
You probably have a bucket list if you enjoy traveling. Your travel bucket list is pretty unique to you. But if it’s your goal to see a lot of the United States, you might have a national park or two on your list of dream destinations. There are dozens of U.S. national parks. That means there’s a national park perfect for everybody. Depending on your priorities, you might want to see a park without the crowds . Or you might hope to visit a park near a major city . 
Regardless of the park you choose, it’s a great idea to look beyond the country’s most popular national parks. After all, the National Park Service operates 417 national parks, including 59 sites that incorporate “National Park” as part of their proper names. Most of us think of the country’s most popular parks when we think “national park.” We all know somebody who has visited the Great Smoky Mountains or the Grand Canyon. We’re all familiar with names like Yosemite and Rocky Mountain National Park. Equally familiar are parks, such as Zion, Yellowstone, and Olympic. And we’ve all read plenty of magazine features about Acadia, Grand Teton, and Glacier. 
But the most popular (and most Instagrammed) U.S. national parks aren’t the only ones you should consider if you’re in search of natural beauty, unique sights, unusual ecological features, and fun outdoor activities. Whether you’re compiling the ultimate bucket list or just planning ahead for your next vacation, it pays to go somewhere off the beaten path. Read on to check out some of the underrated national parks that you might enjoy even more than the country’s most popular parks.
